label: Description
value: Fragment of a square tapestry woven panel of purple wool and undyed linen. Some slit-tapestry. Design showing large roundel with scrolls, and an animal form at center. Geometric shapes at border.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, linen Technique: tapestry weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1965: Albright-Knox Art Gallery collection; 1965: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Fragment of dull rose, red, blue-green, dark yellow and metallic threads. Center has a band with Kufic inscription. Right and left show part of a roundel with additional inscriptions.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: compound plain weave

label: Description
value: Narrow band, linen warps and wool wefts in slit tapestry. Dark red background with repeated design unit of stepped cross within stepped diamond shape in yellow, black and red.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen warp, wool weft Technique: slit tapestry, double faced, wefts perpendicular to warp; sides intact, and ends cut

label: Description
value: Band, cotton, solidly embroidered in cotton in design of winged figures in green, blue, gold, and red on green background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, embroidered in cotton Technique: embroidery on plain weave foundation

label: Description
value: Wedge-shaped fragment of dark green with pattern in dark yellow-gold. Horizontal band at bottom in cream-color, light red and tan. Design has a small-scale pattern of eight-pointed star framing petals, alternating with rosette in a circle. Narrow green line about band. Pattern in band of small confronted lions and Kufic script.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: plain and twill weave, reversible

label: Description
value: Red-orange ground with small lattice pattern in gold, enclosing Kufic inscription: "garment of health." Warps of red-orange silk covering surface except where red weft, of cotton, shows through worn parts. Extra weft of gold, wound on a silk core, forms pattern and floats on back as in brocading.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton, metallic thread Technique: 4&1 satin with continuous supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Design of two tangent roundels in gold, framing confronted seated figures, each holding a tambourine; hanging lamp in between. Faces are white, hair or caps are red, robes are blue-green with cross-shaped pattern in gold. Interstice, above, gold roundel framing interlaced ornament, blue star center.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk core Technique: compound plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 40 x 11.5 cm (15 3/4 x 4 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Border of a tablecover made of  linen net and embroidered in colored silks. Edged with narrow lace edging.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, linen Technique: embroidered net and needle lace (?)

label: Description
value: Man's coat of  cotton, painted and mordant dyed. Patterns of many groups of small figures, arranged on little "islands" of color, - hunters, woman with child, man on camel, one elephant, birds, trees, buildings with pointed towers. In colors of red, blue, yellow, green, brown. Figures are small, two inches or less. Repeat about 15" long. The style is long and flaring; deep opening collar to waist, fastened with two small buttons. Opening for hands at sides, 10" long. Sleeves long, pointed, fastened elbow to end with loops and buttons. Trimmed with red cotton; lined with cream-white cotton.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: mordant painted and dyed and resist dyed (chintz) on plain weave

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: grid of withdrawn element work with needle lace, reticella style

label: Description
value: Cream white tape worked into loops with connecting needle work.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen (?) Technique: rick-rack used as tape with needle lace fillings.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (overall): 54 × 73.7 cm (21 1/4 in. × 29 in.)

label: Description
value: Hindu-type embroidery. Panel or cover with scenes from Spring Festival. Two layers of cotton embroidered in silk and purple, green, yellow, gold, red, and blue. Panel divided.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, mirror inserts Technique: embroidered and appliquéd

label: Description
value: Hollowed rectangular anthropomorphic form with long tapering ears framing deep bulbous forehead above pierced rectangular eyes, and bisected by elongated straight nose. Dark brown patina.

label: Provenance
value: Bernhard Richter; 1965: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Lozenge pattern on light brown background, diamond shapes built up of four orange and four blue lines on left side of each diamond and black leaf-shapes radiating from obtuse angle. Outlined with orange and blue on right side of each diamond. In centers of lozenges alternating, groupings of black dots, and small black floral sprigs. Taken from a screen purchased c. 1920-40 from antique departmentt of John Wanamaker Department Store, New York.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Thornton W. Marshall

label: Description
value: Sleeve band of light blue cotton, embroidered in wool at one side in small-scale geometric pattern, entwined by a repeated "S" pattern. Edged with dark blue cotton on three sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool on cotton Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Sleeve band of grey cotton, embroidered in wool at one side in small sclaed geometric pattern, outlined by a repeated "T" pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool on cotton Technique: embroidered

value: Sleeve band of grey cotton, embroidered in wool at one side in small-scaled geometric pattern, outlined by a running and repeated "T" pattern.

value: Sleeve band of grey cotton, embroidered in wool at one side in small scaled geometric pattern, outlined by a running and repeated "T" pattern.

label: Description
value: On light brown ground, small repeating stencil-like pattern: diamond-diaper formed by beige flower forms, scrolls, etc. with red flower centered in each opening. Printed in margin: "Chesterfield Design wp8640 Scalamandre Wallpaper."

label: Description
value: Fragment with horizontal ribs has vertical stripes in royal blue that alternate with narrow vertical stripes of brown, red, black, yellow and light green that enclose a floral stripe in a chinè effect.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk Technique: warp printed

label: Description
value: Shawl with large-scale leaves. Center in light green with repeated almond shapes in pairs surrounded by floral elements. Center enframed by four outer borders of varying widths. Predominantly red and green.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: twill tapestry weave, pieced Label: wool twill tapestry, pieced together

label: Description
value: On blue-gray ground, a seated figure of the Virgin Mary holding the Christ child on her lap. She gestures with her right hand, her eyes cast down.
